title.rendered: Paving the Way for a Smoother Journey: Two-Layer Elevated Road on NH-8 from Dhaula Kuan to Manesar

content.rendered:
A Visionary Solution to Tackle Traffic Congestion between Delhi and Gurgaon

As urbanization continues to surge, the challenges of traffic congestion and connectivity demand innovative solutions. The recent proposal for a two-layer elevated road over NH-8 from Dhaula Kuan to Manesar is a promising step towards mitigating traffic bottlenecks between Delhi and Gurgaon. Spearheaded by the visionary initiative of Gurgaon MP and Union Minister Rao Inderjit Singh, the project has garnered in-principle approval from the esteemed road transport minister Nitin Gadkari in December 2022. Expected to be dedicated exclusively to light vehicles, this elevated stretch aims to alleviate congestion, particularly at the critical Sirhaul border, and improve travel experiences for commuters.

A Beacon of Hope

The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) is set to select a consultant within the next two months to undertake a comprehensive feasibility study for the project. The study will include future traffic projections for the next 25 years, ensuring that the proposed elevated road can cater to the growing traffic demands and remains effective in the long run. Recognizing the pressing need for infrastructure development to manage the ever-increasing traffic volume between Delhi and Manesar, the authorities are committed to finding sustainable solutions that promote seamless travel experiences.

An Answer to Congestion Woes

Traffic congestion on NH-8 has long been a major concern for both commuters and city authorities. Rao Inderjit Singh’s efforts to highlight the persistent traffic jams and the subsequent wastage of valuable time during daily commutes led to the conceptualization of this ambitious elevated road project. By providing an elevated corridor dedicated to light vehicles, the plan aims to enhance traffic flow, reduce travel time, and boost overall transportation efficiency.


The proposed elevated road is not only significant for commuters but also for Delhi International Airport Limited (DIAL), which is proactively working on capacity augmentation for road-based links between the Indira Gandhi International Airport (IGI) and Gurgaon. With IGI’s passenger traffic expected to rise substantially by the end of 2023, the decongestion of NH-8 assumes utmost importance for smooth access to the airport. This project comes as a ray of hope for millions of travelers who depend on the Delhi-Gurgaon corridor.

Resolving Challenges and Embracing Progress

While the idea of the elevated road faced initial resistance from NHAI officials due to concerns regarding the Dhaula Kuan flyover’s proximity to the international airport, Gadkari’s forward-thinking approach triumphed. He overruled objections and directed NHAI to prepare a detailed project report (DPR) for the proposed elevated road. Careful planning and coordination will be crucial to ensure that the new elevated road complements the existing infrastructure without creating disruptions for flights at the airport.

The Bigger Picture

The upcoming two-layer elevated road on NH-8 from Dhaula Kuan to Manesar represents a significant stride towards solving traffic congestion issues between Delhi and Gurgaon. Rao Inderjit Singh’s foresight and commitment to addressing commuters’ woes have paved the way for a transformational project that will enhance connectivity, reduce travel time, and improve the overall quality of life for millions of people.


As the NHAI prepares to appoint a consultant and conduct a comprehensive feasibility study, citizens can anticipate a brighter future with smoother journeys, efficient connectivity, and a welcome respite from the burden of traffic congestion. Embracing progress and innovation, this visionary project sets an example for how thoughtful infrastructural planning can reshape the landscape of urban travel and lay the foundation for a more sustainable and interconnected future.
